content.raw:
It all looks simple enough and I'm happy to merge after I check something: one possibility is that by compiling with a certain version of numpy (likely a recent one), you may have introduced a dependency on a minimum version of the numpy C API.

I'll pull and check what occurs if running with an old numpy. I don't have a problem depending on a newer version of numpy, but we should know which version and put a check in. Since the extension isn't using any esoteric numpy features, hopefully it might be binary compatible with a wide range of numpy versions.

It all looks simple enough and I'm happy to merge after I check something: one possibility is that by compiling with a certain version of numpy (likely a recent one), you may have introduced a dependency on a minimum version of the numpy C API.

I'll pull and check what occurs if running with an old numpy. I don't have a problem depending on a newer version of numpy, but we should know which version and put a check in. Since the extension isn't using any esoteric numpy features, hopefully it might be binary compatible with a wide range of numpy versions.
